alert.note: Alert for Henry; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:44PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Randolph and eastern Henry Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 244 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Castle, or 11 miles northwest of Cambridge City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Randolph and eastern Henry Counties, including the following locations... Summit Lake State Park, Mount Summit, Losantville, Modoc, Lynn, Cadiz, Blountsville and Mooreland. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 124 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for east central Indiana.
